title: Accounting Manager Job at Ascentech Services Limited
content:
Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounting Manager
Job Location: Isheri, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Supervises: Finance Officers

Position Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Accounting Manager to lead our finance team and oversee all aspects of financial management, including accounts payable and receivable, cost accounting, financial reporting, and ERP integration.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong background in manufacturing finance, sound financial judgment, and a deep understanding of accounting principles in a fast-paced environment.
	Experience in the manufacturing sector is essential, and preference will be given to candidates residing around Isheri, Lagos or its environs.


Key Responsibilities
Accounts Management:


	Timely and accurate invoicing of customers
	Weekly reconciliation of: Staff accounts, Vendor accounts, Related general ledger accounts.
	Daily and weekly reconciliation of: Sales with production and inventory, Sales collections, Customer accounts with bank statements.


General Accounting Duties:


	Prepare and update monthly prepayment schedules.
	Manage payment ledgers and execute monthly amortization.
	Weekly and monthly bank reconciliations, with detailed reports on outstanding items.
	Post and review all necessary accounting journal entries including bank charges.
	Review and validate GL codes monthly and adjust as needed.
	Follow up on outstanding items and staff account balances.
	Present weekly revenue/sales reports and monthly aged receivables.


Compliance & Risk Management:


	Ensure adherence to company financial policies and regulatory standards.
	Maintain accurate records and documentation for audits.
	Support continuous improvement of internal controls and financial systems.


Food Safety & Quality Management Responsibilities:


	Understand and adhere to departmental quality and food safety objectives.
	Support implementation and effectiveness of QMS and FSMS (e.g., FSSC 22000).
	Be aware of and address identified quality and food safety risks in work activities.
	Report any food safety hazards or QMS/FSMS non-conformities to the appropriate team.
	Maintain personal hygiene standards and ensure operational control procedures are followed.


Qualifications & Experience


	Education: B.Sc. / HND in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Experience: Minimum of 5 years in progressive finance roles, with at least 2 years in a managerial or leadership capacity.
	Proven experience in: Financial data analysis and performance optimization, ERP implementation and financial systems integration, Managing financial risk and driving business results.
	Mandatory: Experience working in the manufacturing sector.
	Experience in FMCG is highly desirable.


Core Competencies:


	Strong financial acumen and strategic thinking.
	Exceptional leadership and team-building abilities.
	Excellent communication and presentation skills.
	High level of integrity, professionalism, and ethical conduct.
	Strong interpersonal, collaboration, and conflict resolution skills.
	Analytical reasoning and sound problem-solving capabilities.
	Independence, objectivity, and assertiveness.


Additional Requirements:


	A solid understanding of QMS, FSMS, and FSSC 22000 standards is essential.
	Must be committed to maintaining high standards in both financial performance and product safety/compliance.
	Location Preference: Candidates residing in or around Isheri, Lagos will be given strong consideration due to proximity to the workplace.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: taiwo@ascentech.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Health and Safety Officer (Transport) Job at Dangote Group
content:
Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Health and Safety Officer (Transport)

Job Location: Obajana, Kogi

Job Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Health and Safety Officer (Transport) is responsible for ensuring that the transportation operations within Dangote Cement Transport comply with all health and safety regulations.
	The officer's role includes developing, implementing, and enforcing safety programs specifically tailored for transportation activities.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement health and safety policies and procedures for transportation activities.
	Conduct regular inspections and audits to ensure compliance with local and federal safety regulations.
	Investigate accidents and incidents to determine root causes and recommend corrective actions.
	Maintain safety records and prepare reports on transportation safety performance.
	Provide training and guidance to transportation staff on safety practices, emergency procedures, and equipment operation.
	Assess risks and implement mitigation strategies for transportation operations.
	Coordinate with local authorities and regulatory bodies regarding transportation safety standards.
	Act as a liaison for safety concerns related to the transport fleet and drivers.
	Monitor the effectiveness of existing safety programs and suggest improvements.
	Participate in safety meetings and present relevant safety data and insights to management.


Requirements


	B.Sc. in Safety Management, Environmental Science, or a relevant field.
	Minimum 3 years of experience in a safety role within the transportation or logistics sector.
	Certification in Occupational Health and Safety (NEBOSH, IOSH, or equivalent).
	Graduate Environmental Science, Industrial Hygiene, or a related discipline, preferably in sciences or engineering.
	Professional Certificate or Diploma in fire, safety, health or environmental management from a recognized institution is an added advantage, e.g NEBOSH, IGC, NVQ Level 6
	Awareness of Fleet safety management
	In-depth knowledge of health and safety regulations related to transportation.


Skills and Behaviors:


	Knowledge in training mentoring and development practices
	Good analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and address potential hazards.
	Ability to speak Hausa is an added advantage
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to develop effective training programs.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Proficient in MS Office Suite and safety management software.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


 Benefits


	Private Health Insurance
	Paid Time Off
	Training & Development.

title: Procurement Officer Job at HelloFresh Fast Food
content:
HelloFresh Fast Food, a fast growing restaurant in Anambra State, Onitsha, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer
Job Location: Onitsha, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a team-orientated candidate to fill the position of procurement officer at Hello Fresh Fast Food, Fegge, Onitsha, Anambra State.
	The ideal candidate must have an OND, HND or B.Sc. The procurement officer will be responsible for overseeing the sourcing and purchasing of food, beverages, and essential supplies for restaurant operations.
	This role involves using our software to manage inventory levels, prepare weekly reports using Microsoft Excel, perform inventory reconciliation, and ensure efficient demand and supply planning.
	The role also requires close collaboration with internal teams to align procurement activities with operational needs and business goals.


Reuirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / HND / Bachelor's Degree in relevant disciplines with experience.


Salary & Benefits


	Competitive salary based on qualifications and experience.
	Relocation allowance available for qualified candidates.
	Opportunities for growth and professional development.
	Supportive and dynamic work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: hellofreshrecruit@gmail.com using "Application for Procurement Officer" as the subject of the email.

title: Front Desk / Customer Service Executive Job at Style Fusion Salon and Spa
content:
Style Fusion Salon and Spa, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk / Customer Service Executive

Job Location: Nyanya-Karshi Road, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a smart, customer-oriented, and highly organized Front Desk / Customer Service Executive to be the welcoming face of our upscale Salon & Spa.
	In this role, you will be the first point of contact for clients and play a vital role in ensuring smooth operations, excellent customer satisfaction, and overall guest experience.


Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Greet clients warmly upon arrival and provide a welcoming and professional first impression
	Answer incoming calls, respond to messages, and manage all client inquiries across phone, email, or walk-in
	Manage daily appointment scheduling using our salon software, ensuring accurate and timely bookings
	Handle check-ins and check-outs, ensuring payments are processed accurately and receipts are issued
	Educate clients on available services, promotions, and retail products
	Keep client records updated and manage customer feedback loops
	Maintain inventory of front desk supplies and inform management of restocking needs
	Maintain an organized and visually appealing front desk and waiting area
	Handle customer complaints or concerns calmly and professionally, escalating issues to management as needed
	Coordinate with stylists, therapists, and other staff to ensure timely service delivery
	Follow up with clients post-appointment to gather feedback and encourage repeat visits.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Minimum of 1–2 years of experience in front desk, reception, or customer service role (experience in a salon, spa, or hospitality setting is an advantage)
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and salon management software (or willing to learn)
	Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
	Friendly, polished appearance and a positive attitude
	Ability to work flexible hours, including weekends and holidays.


Salary
N50,000 - N100,000 Monthly.

Note


	 Only candidates who meet our requirements will be contacted
	 Incomplete applications will not be processed.
	 Ensure all details are accurate before submission.
